net.wenheqi.util.encoding

Class Base62.Decoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.wenheqi.util.encoding.Base62.Decoder
  • Enclosing class:
    Base62

    public static class Base62.Decoder
extends Object
    This class implements a decoder for decoding byte data using the Base62 encoding scheme as specified in Base62.Encoder. Instances of Base62.Decoder class are safe for use by multiple concurrent threads.

    Unless otherwise noted, passing a null argument to a method of this class will cause a NullPointerException to be thrown.

    See Also:
    Base62.Encoder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] decode(byte[] src)
      Decodes all bytes from the input byte array using the Base62 encoding scheme, writing the results into a newly-allocated output byte array.
      byte[] decode(String str)
      Converts each character in the str to a byte array of the corresponding index in alphabet, and then decode all bytes using the Base62 encoding scheme, writing the results into a newly-allocated output byte array.
      Base62.Decoder withAlphabet(char[] alphabet)
      Returns an decoder instance that decodes equivalently to this one, but with a specified decoding alphabet.
      Base62.Decoder withPadToWidth(int padToWidth)
      Returns an decoder instance that decodes equivalently to this one, but with a specified padToWidth value.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • decode

        public byte[] decode(byte[] src)
        Decodes all bytes from the input byte array using the Base62 encoding scheme, writing the results into a newly-allocated output byte array.
        Parameters:
        src - the byte array to decode
        Returns:
        A newly-allocated byte array containing the decoded bytes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if src is not in valid Base64 scheme

      • decode

        public byte[] decode(String str)
        Converts each character in the str to a byte array of the corresponding index in alphabet, and then decode all bytes using the Base62 encoding scheme, writing the results into a newly-allocated output byte array.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to decode
        Returns:
        A newly-allocated byte array containing the decoded bytes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if str is not in valid Base64 scheme

      • withAlphabet

        public Base62.Decoder withAlphabet(char[] alphabet)
        Returns an decoder instance that decodes equivalently to this one, but with a specified decoding alphabet. The padToWidth is unaffected by this invocation.
        Parameters:
        alphabet - The alphabet to be used to decode the data
        Returns:
        an equivalent decoder that decodes with specified alphabet

      • withPadToWidth

        public Base62.Decoder withPadToWidth(int padToWidth)
        Returns an decoder instance that decodes equivalently to this one, but with a specified padToWidth value. The default decoder has padToWidth set to 0, i.e. no padding will be added to the decoded result. If specified and the result byte array has a smaller length than padToWidth, the result will be padded from the beginning of the array with bytes of 0 value to meet the width requirement. The alphabet is unaffected by this invocation.
        Parameters:
        padToWidth - The min length of result byte array after decoding
        Returns:
        an equivalent decoder that decodes with specified padToWidth
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if padToWidth < 0
